headline.main: NAZI SPY FORECAST THE MEETING AT SEA; But He Reported Roosevelt-Churchill Talks 7 Months Before They Happened PLAN OF TRANSPORT MADE Seaman Wanted to Send It to Germany, FBI Man Says at Espionage Trial of 16

lead_paragraph: President Roosevelt's historic meeting at sea with Prime Minister Winston Churchill was forecast last January by a self-confessed agent of the German espionage service, according to testimony yesterday at the Brooklyn espionage trial.
abstract: Sebold testifies E W Siegler reptd Churchill instead of Halifax meeting with Roosevelt and Knox on HMS King George V in Jan and H R Kleiss furnished blueprint on SS America conversion into troop transport
snippet: President Roosevelt's historic meeting at sea with Prime Minister Winston Churchill was forecast last January by a self-confessed agent of the German espionage service, according to testimony yesterday at the Brooklyn espionage trial....
